subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Alphabetical Order
msgSnippet: Thanks John for saving me trawling through my personal dictionary for words such as rod/roared hod/hoard hotty/haughty knotty/naughty and a long list more.
messageBody:
Thanks John for saving me trawling through my personal dictionary for
words such as

rod/roared hod/hoard hotty/haughty knotty/naughty

and a long list more.

There is a redundant letter IMHO in the table though, and that is the alternative Thither.
While it does have limited use, it is more useful in writing than in typing.

Moira

On 21/11/2007, Paul Tremblay < phthenry@...> wrote:

John Cowan wrote:
>
>
> Paul Tremblay scripsit:
>
> > But to be fair to Moira, that still means she has to give up a phoneme.
> > What words would lose their distinction, Moira, if you had to use Awl
> > for both On and Awl?
>
> cot/caught, tot/taught, bot/bought, sod/sawed, hock/hawk, Don/Dawn,
> body/bawdy, clod/clawed, dotter/daughter, bobble/bauble, col/caul,
> and certainly lots more. (Easy for me: the first are LOT, the second
> THOUGHT, which are merged with PALM and CLOTH.)

 Okay, this helps. So we'll have to see if users want to give up this
distinction.

Paul
